newsitem.title: FRANCE: ATHLETICS-BAILEY SHOWS U.S. PAIR WHO IS BOSS.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-BAILEY SHOWS U.S. PAIR WHO IS BOSS.

text.p: Donovan Bailey put young U.S. pretenders Maurice Green and Tim Montgomery firmly in their place with a commanding victory in the 100 metres at the Paris grand prix meeting on Wednesday.
The Canadian world and Olympic champion won in 10.07 seconds in drizzly and chilly conditions at the Charlety stadium as he builds up towards the defence of his world title in Athens in August.
"The weather isn't good but I always like to come to Paris and win the 100," Bailey said.

Green and Montgomery finished first and second at the U.S. national championships two weeks ago with times of 9.90 and 9.92 respectively, sounding a warning to Bailey ahead of the world championships.
Montgomery was second in 10.12 with compatriots Brian Lewis (10.19) and Green (10.23) third and fourth.
In-form American Bryan Bronson won the 400 metres hurdles for his second successive win over Olympic champion and compatriot Derrick Adkins.
Bronson ran the third fastest time of the year, 48.15 seconds, easily beating Zambia's Samuel Matete (48.93) into second place. Adkins was third in 48.96.
